API: Writers (Video & Data)¶

Utilities for writing processed video files (MP4/BAG) and saving JSON/CSV data.

Video Writer Factory

Creates appropriate video writers for RealSense-only recording:

  • BAG (RealSense): Full depth + RGB data for processing

  • MP4 (H.264): Compressed RGB, browser-compatible, for viewing/tagging

Recording Behavior:

  • RealSense cameras: .bag (depth + RGB) + .mp4 (RGB preview)

class writers.BagWriter(filepath: str, pipeline, config=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

RealSense BAG file writer for recording depth + RGB data.

Uses the RealSense SDK’s built-in recording capability. BAG files are used for processing (contains depth data for gait analysis).

isOpened() → bool[source]¶

Check if writer is ready.

pause_recording()[source]¶

Pause recording.

release()[source]¶

Stop recording and close the BAG file.

start_recording()[source]¶

Start/resume recording.

write(frame)[source]¶

Note: BAG files record automatically from pipeline. This method is a no-op for API compatibility.

class writers.FFmpegWriter(filepath: str, frame_size: Tuple[int, int], fps: int = 30)[source]¶

Bases: object

FFmpeg-based video writer for browser-compatible H.264 MP4.

Uses libx264 encoder piped through stdin for reliable browser playback. This is the recommended writer for MP4 files.

isOpened() → bool[source]¶

Check if writer is ready.

release()[source]¶

Close FFmpeg process.

write(frame)[source]¶

Write a frame to FFmpeg stdin.

writers.create_bag_writer(filepath: str, pipeline) → BagWriter | None[source]¶

Create BAG writer for RealSense recording.

Parameters:

  • filepath – Output file path (should end in .bag)

  • pipeline – Active RealSense pipeline

Returns:

BagWriter instance or None if not available

writers.create_high_quality_writer(filepath: str, frame_size: Tuple[int, int], fps: int, camera_type: str, pipeline=None, serial: str | None = None)[source]¶

Create BAG writer for RealSense recording.

Only BAG format is supported (no AVI fallback). Returns None writer on failure so the caller can handle the error gracefully.

Parameters:

  • filepath – Base output path (extension will be set to .bag automatically)

  • frame_size – (width, height) tuple

  • fps – Frames per second

  • camera_type – Expected to be CAMERA_TYPE_REALSENSE

  • pipeline – Unused (kept for API compatibility)

  • serial – RealSense device serial number

Returns:

Tuple of (writer, actual_filepath, recording_pipeline) writer is None if BAG recording failed.

writers.create_mp4_writer(filepath: str, frame_size: Tuple[int, int], fps: int = 30) → FFmpegWriter | VideoWriter[source]¶

Create MP4 video writer for browser-compatible H.264.

Prefers FFmpeg (more reliable) with OpenCV fallback.

Parameters:

  • filepath – Output file path (should end in .mp4)

  • frame_size – (width, height) tuple

  • fps – Frames per second

Returns:

FFmpegWriter or cv2.VideoWriter instance

writers.start_realsense_recording(filepath: str, serial: str | None = None) → Tuple[any, any][source]¶

Start a new RealSense pipeline configured for BAG recording.

This is the recommended way to record BAG files - start a new pipeline with recording enabled from the beginning.

Parameters:

  • filepath – Output .bag file path

  • serial – Optional device serial number

Returns:

Tuple of (pipeline, config) or (None, None) on failure

writers.stop_realsense_recording(pipeline) → bool[source]¶

Stop RealSense pipeline recording.

Parameters:

pipeline – Active recording pipeline

Returns:

True if stopped successfully
